metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 1 â€” DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS, ACCOUNTING POLICIES, AND SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES/
aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon Revenue Recognition and Service Offerings
Revenue is recognized when control of the goods is transferred to the customer.
Control of goods generally transfers upon Amazon's delivery to a third-party carrier.
Control of goods alternatively transfers upon Amazon's direct delivery to the customer.
Amazon offers third-party seller services.
Third-party seller services enable sellers to sell their products in Amazon stores.
Third-party seller services enable sellers to fulfill orders using Amazon services.
Amazon is not the seller of record in third-party seller transactions.
Amazon earns commissions from third-party seller arrangements.
Amazon earns fulfillment fees from third-party seller arrangements.
Amazon earns shipping fees from third-party seller arrangements.
Commissions from third-party seller arrangements are recognized when services are rendered.
Fulfillment fees from third-party seller arrangements are recognized when services are rendered.
Shipping fees from third-party seller arrangements are recognized when services are rendered.
Services are generally rendered upon delivery of products to a third-party carrier.
Services are alternatively rendered upon Amazon's direct delivery to the customer.
Amazon provides advertising services.
Amazon provides advertising services to sellers.
Amazon provides advertising services to vendors.
Amazon provides advertising services to publishers.
Amazon provides advertising services to authors.
Amazon provides advertising services to others.
Amazon's advertising services include sponsored ads.
Amazon's advertising services include display advertising.
Amazon's advertising services include video advertising.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 1 â€” DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS, ACCOUNTING POLICIES, AND SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES/

/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 1 â€” DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS, ACCOUNTING POLICIES, AND SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES/

text:
Revenue is recognized when control of the goods is transferred to the customer, which generally occurs upon our delivery to a third-party carrier or, in the case of an Amazon delivery, to the customer.

* Third-party seller services - We offer programs that enable sellers to sell their products in our stores, and fulfill orders using our services. We are not the seller of record in these transactions. The commissions and any related fulfillment and shipping fees we earn from these arrangements are recognized when the services are rendered, which generally occurs upon delivery of the related products to a third-party carrier or, in the case of an Amazon delivery, to the customer.

* Advertising services - We provide advertising services to sellers, vendors, publishers, authors, and others, through programs such as sponsored ads, display, and video advertising.
